name: Task.Middleware

aliases.name: Middleware
aliases.comment:
Represent a middleware unit with an associated task. A middleware task has a companion
value to inform the runner to continue with the next task or to end the sequence.

Middleware units are designed to do work on some "payload" similarly as a reducer
works on Redux applications.

    -- A middleware that does almost nothing looks like this.
    \name -> end (Task.succeed "hello " ++ name)

types.name: Error
types.comment:
Represent the unexpected situations when we forget to call `end` in the sequence or some middleware
task failed

values.name: connect
values.comment: Connect a task to another after a mapError to Middlware
values.type: (a -> Task.Task (Task.Middleware.Error x) b) -> Task.Task x a -> Task.Task (Task.Middleware.Error x) b

values.name: end
values.comment:
Transform a `Task` into a return value for a middleware unit choosing to end

    end (Task.fail 420)
values.type: Task.Task x a -> Task.Task x (Task.Middleware.Step a)

values.name: mapError
values.comment: Map a failing middleware error to some other type of error
values.type: (x -> y) -> Task.Middleware.Middleware x a -> Task.Middleware.Middleware y a

values.name: middleware
values.comment:
Merge a list of middleware units into a single task

    middleware
        [ (\n -> next (Task.succeed n))
        , (n -> end (Task.succeed (* n n)))
        ]
        2
values.type: List (Task.Middleware.Middleware x a) -> a -> Task.Task (Task.Middleware.Error x) a

values.name: next
values.comment:
Transform a `Task` into a return value for a middleware unit choosing to continue

    next (Task.succeed 200)
values.type: Task.Task x a -> Task.Task x (Task.Middleware.Step a)
